thread.title: Construction firm Galliford Try brushes off Brexit with contracts worth £60m
thread.title_full: Construction firm Galliford Try brushes off Brexit with contracts worth £60m

author: Coreena Ford
title: Construction firm Galliford Try brushes off Brexit with contracts worth £60m
text:
Construction firm Galliford Try brushes off Brexit with contracts worth £60m 13:37, 29 Sep 2016 The Newcastle construction firm is about to start work on lucrative projects right across the region Share Get business news by email Stephen McCoy, managing director of Galliford try Partnerships North 
The director of a North East construction company has told how the firm has forged ahead since the Brexit vote and is about to embark on a string of lucrative projects. 
Despite post-referendum fears of an industry slowdown, Newcastle-based regeneration specialist Galliford Try Partnerships North has been selected for development frameworks involving projects worth over £60m. 
Within the next few weeks, it hopes to be on sites in Blyth , Killingworth and Chester-le-Street, with projects worth almost £16m that will deliver 104 new homes. 
The company has also been selected by housing provider, Thirteen, to be one of seven construction partners that will bid to deliver up to £45m worth of projects, and by the Riverside Group for its ‘cutting edge’ framework, under which four partners will bid to deliver up to £16m worth of work. 
Since 2012/13, the firm’s annual turnover has grown from just over £8m to almost £60m this year. 
The projects about to begin include a mixture of homes for sale, shared ownership and rent, which are designed to provide more opportunity for people to enjoy the benefits of living in modern, purpose designed energy efficient homes. 
The first scheme likely to go live is on the site of a former residential home in Chester-le-Street , where 20 three-bed houses and two two-bed flats will be constructed, for affordable rent through Cestria Community Housing, part of Isos Housing Group. 
A similar project with the Riverside Group at Camperdown in Killingworth will provide 10 two-bed houses, 26 three-bed homes and four two-bed bungalows. These will all be for shared ownership. 
Subject to planning permission, in October work will commence at North Farm, Blyth, on behalf of the company’s new homes division – Linden Homes – to create 22 four-bed properties, 19 with three bedrooms and a two-bed bungalow. Read More North East welcomes Heathrow Airport plans to increase domestic flights 
Stephen McCoy, managing director of Galliford Try Partnerships North, said: “It’s true that after a huge expansion over the past few years we have seen the industry slow in recent months but fortunately we have been successful in securing new work which enables us to continue our expansion. 
“We are delighted to have been able to forge strong and successful relationships with our partners and I think this has been the catalyst for selection to carry out work on a repeat basis.”
